page.title: 15LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: TRAVELLERS REST,EAST KESWICK. THE TRAVELLERS REST IS A PUBLIC HOUSE BUILT ABOUT 1780.AT THE FRONT OF THE BUILDING IS AN OLD WATER PUMP WHICH WAS THE ONLY PUMP FOR THE VILLAGE. THERE IS AN EXCELLENT VIEW OF THE RIVER WHARFE FROM THE WINDOWS.THE GENERAL MANAGER'S NAME IS CHARLES A. CROSSFIELD. OPENING TIMES. MONDAY - THURSDAY 12.00 - 2.30 p.m. 6.30 -10.30 p.m. FRIDAY,SATURDAY 12.00 - 2.30 p.m. 6.00 -11.00 p.m. SUNDAY 12.00 - 2.30 p.m. 7.00 -10.30 p.m. THERE IS AN EXCELLENT RESTAURANT SEATING 56 WITH A WIDE CHOICE OF MENUS.CHILDREN ARE WELCOMED IN THE RESTAURANT.THERE IS ALSO A CHILDREN'S PLAYGROUND AREA,PICNIC AREA WITH TABLES AND A LARGE CAR PARK.
